snippet: New York State must do more to curb the arrests of tens of thousands of people each year for minor possession of marijuana.
abstract: Editorial calls for New York State to do more to curb the arrests of tens of thousands of people each year for minor possession of marijuana, despite a 1977 state law that decriminalized it; urges state legislature to pass bills that will help reduce the inequity in the law by making public possession of a small amount a violation instead of a misdemeanor.
lead_paragraph: New York State must do more to curb the arrests of tens of thousands of people each year for minor possession of marijuana.
